items.title: Project Name
items.description: A concise project name present at the top of context/goal.md or README.md (single-line).
items.remarks: No project name found in context/goal.md or README.md.

items.title: Project Brief (elevator)
items.description: A 1–2 line elevator pitch describing what the project does and its core value; located in context/goal.md under 'Brief' or in README.md 'About' section.

items.title: Project Goals
items.description: Active and completed goals listed in context/goal.md under 'Active Goals' and 'Completed Goals' (short bullets, each ≤15 words).

items.title: Primary Contact / Owner
items.description: Owner or maintainer contact (name, GitHub handle, or email) in context/goal.md or README.md 'Maintainers' section.

items.title: Stack Summary
items.description: Languages, frameworks, and key libraries (e.g., Python 3.x, FastAPI, React) listed in README.md or context/goal.md; include where deps are declared (pyproject.toml/package.json/requirements.txt).
items.remarks: Stack not evident from README or dependency files.

items.title: Dependency files
items.description: Presence of dependency manifest(s): pyproject.toml, requirements.txt, package.json. State which file(s) the project uses.

items.title: Entrypoints
items.description: Precise runtime entry file(s) (e.g., src/main.py, server.js) and where to open first; list in context/goal.md or context/understanding_sources file.

items.title: Dev Commands
items.description: Exact commands to set up dev environment and run the app locally (copy-pasteable), e.g., 'poetry install' and 'poetry run uvicorn src.main:app --reload'; expected in README.md 'Getting Started' or context/to_do.md.

items.title: Test Commands
items.description: Exact command(s) to run the test suite (e.g., 'pytest tests/'); documented in README.md or context/to_do.md.

items.title: Configuration & Env
items.description: Where runtime configuration and required environment variables live (example .env, env docs, or README section 'Configuration'); list variables and brief purpose.

items.title: Database / Storage
items.description: If the app uses persistent storage, indicate DB type, connection hints, migrations (where migrations live), and backup notes; documented in README.md or context/goal.md.

items.title: Deployment / Where it Runs
items.description: Notes on how the app is deployed (hosts, cloud provider, Docker, serverless) and any deployment commands; documented in README.md or deployment docs.

items.title: Health / Observability
items.description: Presence of health endpoint (e.g., /health), logging, or metrics notes; documented in README or monitoring docs.

items.title: CI / Tests Status
items.description: Whether CI exists and where (GitHub Actions, etc.), basic status and what runs on PRs; expected in repo root (.github/workflows) or README badges.

items.title: Usage Examples / Quickstart
items.description: Short runnable example(s) showing a typical flow (curl example or sample request) in README.md or docs/ examples/; helps agent craft tests and instructions.

items.title: License & Contribution Guide
items.description: License file present and a CONTRIBUTING.md or short contributor guide in repo root or docs/; indicates legal and contribution expectations.

items.title: To-Do Items
items.description: Actionable checklist in context/to_do.md with at least one pending item; used by agent for small tasks and prioritization.

items.title: Think Later Backlog
items.description: Ideas backlog in context/think_later.md with at least one idea entry (prefix 'Idea:'), used for brainstorming and future features.

items.title: README Minimal (getting started)
items.description: README contains minimal sections: About, Getting Started (dev commands), and How to Run; used by agent as first-ref.
items.remarks: README lacks Getting Started or About sections.

summary.remarks: Initialized: run /check_context to verify and update clarity across items.
